sentences.en: All London was agog to see the two " parents " of radium.
sentences.cn: 伦敦全城都渴望见到这两位镭的 “ 父母 ”.

sentences.en: At one end of the barrel there was some radium.
sentences.cn: 枪管的一端装有镭.

sentences.en: He was the discoverer of the element radium.
sentences.cn: 他是镭元素的发现者.

sentences.en: It is produced from radium in the decay chain of uranium, an element found in varying amounts in all rocks and soil.
sentences.cn: 它产生于铀衰变链中的镭，而铀是所有岩石和土壤中都能找到的一种元素，含量各不相同。

sentences.en: Madame Curie discovered radium.
sentences.cn: 居里夫人发现了镭。

sentences.en: Madame Curie was the physicist with expertise in chemistry that, in 1898, discovered the radioactive substances of radium and polonium in Paris, France.
sentences.cn: 居里夫人是一位具有化学专门知识的物理学家。 1898年，她在法国巴黎发现了放射性物质的镭和钋。

sentences.en: Radioactivity is a special quality of radium.
sentences.cn: 放射性是镭的一种特性.

sentences.en: Radium and uranium are radioactive elements.
sentences.cn: 镭和铀是放射性元素.

sentences.en: Radium can be fixed some distance from its original source.
sentences.cn: 镭在离它的原始母体一定距离上固定下来.

sentences.en: Radium can be used to treat cancer.
sentences.cn: 镭可以用来治疗癌症.

sentences.en: Radon is the daughter of radium.
sentences.cn: 氡是镭的子体.

sentences.en: She looked for radium four years in the experiment work.
sentences.cn: 她在四年实验工作中寻找镭.

sentences.en: Tell me when radium was found.
sentences.cn: 告诉我镭是什么时候被发现的.

sentences.en: Thanks to her inexhaustible patience and iron will, she had obtained stronger concentrations of the radium.
sentences.cn: 幸亏她有无穷无尽的耐心和铁一般的意志, 她才得到了浓缩度较大的镭.

sentences.en: The  radiation  radius of the  radioactive  radium  radiator in the  stadium is  variable.
sentences.cn: 放射性的镭暖气装置的辐射半径在体育场是易变的。

sentences.en: The other element, which caused the stronger radiation, was given the name radium.
sentences.cn: 另一种发射更强射线的元素定名为镭.

sentences.en: The scientists who discovered radium did not know that it would kill them.
sentences.cn: 那些发现了镭元素的科学家，并不知道这种元素会让他们丧命。

sentences.en: They had called the rays from it radioactivity; they now decided to call the element radium.
sentences.cn: 他们从放射性特性方面考虑为新元素命名, 于是决定称其为“镭”.

sentences.en: To this something still unseen they gave the name radium.
sentences.cn: 他们给这种人们尚未看到的东西命名为镭.

sentences.en: Who is the scientist firstly find radium?
sentences.cn: 首先发现镭的科学家是谁?

trans.tran_en: a white metal that is  radioactive  and is used in the treatment of diseases such as  cancer  . It is a chemical  element  : symbol Ra
